titles.title: Saguaro National Park Establishment and Expansion Act of 1993
To establish the Saguaro National Park and to authorize the expansion of the boundaries of the Tucson Mountain District of the Saguaro National Park, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1020)
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

bill.summary: 4/22/1993--Introduced. Saguaro National Park Establishment and Expansion Act of 1993 - Redesignates the Saguaro National Monument in Arizona as the Saguaro National Park. Revises the boundaries of the Tucson Mountain District of the Park to include certain lands. Withdraws Federal lands within the Park from public land, mining, and mineral leasing laws and from the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970. Transfers Bureau of Land Management lands within the Park to the National Park Service. Authorizes the transfer of any Federal property located within the boundaries of the Park which is administered by any other U.S. department or agency to the administrative jurisdiction of the Secretary of the Interior for purposes of the Park. Permits acquisition of lands within the boundaries of the Park which are owned by Arizona or any political subdivision only by donation or purchase with donated or appropriated funds. Authorizes appropriations.
